experiences.title: Machine Learning Research Assistant
experiences.description:
** In collaboration with LoginID Company **

I developed a facial recognition system using Fully homomorphic encryption (FHE) using
the LFW dataset and the CNN (Convolutional Neural Network) algorithm. I then transformed
this model into an equivalent encrypted model using the Concrete ML framework from the
French company Zama. I extract the characteristics of an image, encrypt them, and then supply them to my model, which is able to recognize them. All this is done with the aim of
ensuring the security and reliability of sensitive data.

experiences.title: Data Analytics Intern
experiences.description:
During my internship at ONCF, I developed a robust data warehousing solution that involved designing an ETL pipeline to extract data from the operational system, perform transformations, and load it into a SQL Server data warehouse using a constellation schema (an extension of the star schema). I then utilized Power BI to create dashboards and visualizations to present key performance indicators (KPIs).

The solution consists of :

1. Data Source (O.S):
 - The operational system stores data in a Microsoft SQL Server.
 - The data is extracted using an ETL Process involving Python for data handling and SQLAlchemy for interaction with the database.

2. ETL Process:
 - Data is extracted from the SQL Server and transformed via the Python-based ETL pipeline. SQLAlchemy is used to handle the data loading into the data warehouse.
 - This ensures the feeding (alimentation) of the Data-Warehouse, which is stored in another SQL Server instance, called the Data Destination (W.S).

3. Scheduling:
 - The entire process, including ETL jobs and data transfers, is orchestrated using Windows Task Scheduler for automation, ensuring that tasks run periodically as required.

4. Data Visualization:
 - Once the data is loaded into the data warehouse, Power BI is used for data visualization and analysis.
 - DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) is leveraged within Power BI to create complex calculations and KPIs from the data.

ğŸ› ï¸ Tech Stack: SQL Server, SSIS, Python, SQLAlchemy, Power BI, DAX

profile.name: Rachid KABBAB
profile.about:
Experienced Senior Member of Technical Staff, Software Engineer at Oracle, with a strong background in the technology industry. With over 11 years of experience, including 9 years as a senior software engineer and 2 years as a system and network administrator, I am a valuable team player with a deep interest of programming, databases, network programming, operating systems and distributed systems.

I spent 5 years in the payment industry, I've developed a keen interest and expertise in this field. My knowledge extends to payment industry standards, protocols, and technologies such as NDC+, D912 Protocol, ISO 8583, HSM, and EMV. My technical understanding of online payment processing flows, including merchants, acquirer banks, and issuer banks, further contributes to my proficiency in this area.

Passionate about Generative AI, Cloud, Infrastructure, data structures, problem-solving, and system design, I demonstrate a commitment to continuous learning and embrace non-routine environments. I possess excellent coding skills in Java, C, and C++, and have experience in software development using UML and OOP paradigms. I am well-versed in design patterns, code optimization, and software architectures, enabling me to create efficient and robust solutions.

With a deep grasp of computer network fundamentals and experience in network troubleshooting using tools like TCPDump and Wireshark, I exhibit expertise in TCP, UDP, routing, switching, network programming, SSL/TLS, DNS, HTTP, FTP, and more. My proficiency extends to Linux systems administration, shell programming, and Oracle DB administration.

I hold a strong knowledge of databases, including relational, object, relational-object, and NoSQL databases. I am skilled in Oracle APEX, SQL, T-SQL, PLSQL, relational data modeling, and database schema design. Additionally, I have also experience working with XML (DOM, SAX, DTD, XSD, XSLT, XPath) and JSON.

My academic background includes an Engineer's degree ENSMR (Ex. ENIM), a Master's degree from UCA/FSSM, and a Bachelor's degree from UH2/FSAC. I am a C/C++ and Java geek, showcasing my enthusiasm for programming languages.

Always open for new exciting opportunities, so to connect with me, you can reach out to me via LinkedIn or email at rachid.kabbab@gmail.com.

Open to Relocation | Visa Sponsorship Required.

Check out my Linked In profile for seeing some of my side projects : https://github.com/karachid

# PoC: Architect Assistant

â€¢ Developed an AI-powered assistant to help architects search for design patterns related to networking, cloud services, and other technical domains.
â€¢ Designed the data model to support efficient and structured data ingestion.
â€¢ Built a data extraction component to retrieve relevant content from Confluence pages.
â€¢ Implemented a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipeline using Cohere LLM for embeddings and a LLaMA model for text generation.
â€¢ Built the infrastructure on Oracle Cloud to support and deploy the solution securely and efficiently.

# PoC: OpenSearch on Oracle Cloud for Citizen Services

This PoC explored leveraging OCI Search with OpenSearch to enhance citizen services by enabling efficient multilingual search capabilities. It involved setting up an infrastructure environment in Oracle Cloud, integrating a pretrained hosted model for English, and deploying a custom Hugging Face model to support dialects like Swahili and Kinyarwanda. The solution aimed to improve search relevance and accessibility for diverse user groups.

# PoC: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) Pipeline for Insight Summarization

This PoC focused on building a RAG pipeline leveraging LangChain and Oracle 23ai DB as a vector store to generate meaningful summaries of insights from structured event data. The solution processed three key datasets:

Insights Data (event metadata, location, intensity, and timeline)
Event Impact Data (population, infrastructure capacity, severity, and geospatial impact)
Shape Impact Data (quadkey-based geospatial severity mapping)

By embedding and retrieving relevant context from these datasets, the pipeline enabled automated summarization of insights, enhancing analytical capabilities for event-driven decision-making.

# In addition to my main duties, I :
- Mentor interns and junior engineers.
- Conduct technical interviews for interns and full-time employees.

Actually, as an assistant professor, he is teaching Electrical Engineering, C-Phi Systems (embedded Systems) and conducting research related to microwave engineering applications in Physics department at Chouaib Doukkali University in Morocco since 2011. Between February 2010 and March 2011 he worked as Researcher/Engineer in electronic packaging' electrical interconnection at MASciR (Moroccan Association for Scientific and Innovation Researches - Microelectronics Dep., Morocco).

His research interests include the antennas design, UWB and multi Bands Dielectric Resonator antennas, Nano-antennas, Microwave Filters, RFID, Metamaterials applications, Microelectronic Packaging studies at microwave frequency bands and beyond, using computational methods such as the finite difference time domain (FDTD) and TLM methods with the help of electromagnetic commercial simulators (CST MWS/DS, HFSS, ADS,â€¦).

Summary of Responsibilities: 

- Frontend Development: Built an interactive React interface for inputting keywords, selecting clients, filtering articles by date, and viewing results in a sortable, clickable table. 

- Backend Development: Developed RESTful APIs in Flask for managing scraping requests and database interactions, with integrated error handling and logging. 

- Web Scraping: Implemented BeautifulSoup and Scrapy to extract article data (titles, URLs, content, dates) with keyword filtering and date-specific retrieval.

profile.name: Soufiane sejjari
profile.about:
As a Full Stack Engineer and Data Scientist, I build intelligent, data-driven applications from concept to deployment. With a recent Master's degree in Computer Engineering and Data Analysis, I bring a strong foundation in both software architecture and advanced machine learning.

Iâ€™m passionate about turning complex data and business needs into high-impact software solutions. I enjoy working on challenging projects that require both analytical precision and thoughtful engineering design.

My core areas of expertise include:

AI and Data Science: Natural Language Processing, predictive modeling, sentiment analysis, and computer vision using Python, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, and related tools.

Full-Stack Development: Frontend development with Angular and React, and backend development with Spring Boot, Node.js, and FastAPI. I follow clean architecture and modular design principles to ensure maintainability and scalability.

DevOps and Cloud Deployment: Containerization with Docker, CI/CD automation (GitHub Actions, GitLab CI), and multi-tenant SaaS deployments.

Data Engineering: Implementation of ETL workflows, real-time data pipelines using Apache Kafka and Spark, and data modeling with PostgreSQL and Supabase.

Currently, I am exploring how to integrate intelligent agents and proactive AI orchestration into enterprise systems, while continuously improving code quality and system architecture to align with senior engineering standards.

Feel free to reach out if you'd like to connect, collaborate, or exchange ideas around software engineering, data, or artificial intelligence.
